questions.name: If 1, 2, 3 and 4 are the roots of the equation x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d=0 , then a+2b+c is equal to
questions.nameText: If 1, 2, 3 and 4 are the roots of the equation x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d=0 , then a+2b+c is equal to
questions.solution:
If 1, 2, 3, 4 are the roots of given equation, then

x-1x-2x-3x-4=x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d

⇒x2-3x+2x2-7x+12=x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d

⇒x4-10x3+35x2-50x+24

=x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d

⇒a=-10, b=35, c=-50, d=24

∴  a+2b+c=-10+2×35-50=10

Alternate,

Since, 1, 2, 3 and 4 are the roots of the equation

x4+ax3+bx2+cx+d=0 , then

1+a+b+c+d=0 ...(i)

16+8a+4b+2c+d=0 ...(ii)

81+27a+9b+3c+d=0 ...(iii)

And 256+64a+16b+4c+d=0 ...(iv)

On solving Eqs. (i), (ii), (iii) and (iv), we get

a=-10, b=35, c=-50,  d=24

Now, a+2b+c=-10+2×35+-50

=-10+70-50=10

questions.name: If one root of the equation a-bx2+ax+1=0 be double the other and if a∈R, then the greatest value of b is
questions.nameText: If one root of the equation a-bx2+ax+1=0 be double the other and if a∈R, then the greatest value of b is
questions.solution:
Let the roots be α and 2 α. Then,

α+2 α=-aa-band 2 α2=1a-b

⇒α=-a3a-band α2=12(a-b)

⇒a29a-b2=12(a-b)

⇒2a2=9a-9b

⇒2a2-9a+9b=0

⇒81-72b≥0∵a∈R

⇒b≤9/8

Hence, the greatest value of b is 98

questions.name: If the roots of the equation bx2+cx+a=0 be imaginary, then for all real values of x , the expression 3b2x2+6bcx+2c2 is
questions.nameText: If the roots of the equation bx2+cx+a=0 be imaginary, then for all real values of x , the expression 3b2x2+6bcx+2c2  is
questions.solution:
Given bx+cx+a=0 has imaginary roots

⇒c2-4ab<0

⇒c2<4ab

⇒ -c2>-4ab ...((i)

Let fx=3b2x2+6bcx+2c2

Here, 3b2>0

So, the given expression has a minimum value

∴ Minimum value=-D4a

=4ac-b24a

=43b22c2-36b2c24(3b2)

=-12b2c212b2=-c2>-4ab

[from Eq. (i)]

questions.name: The roots of the equation 2x+233x/(x-1)=9 are given by
questions.nameText: The roots of the equation 2x+233x/(x-1)=9 are given by
questions.solution:
We have, 2x+233x/(x-1)=9

Taking log on both sides, we get

x+2log⁡2+3xx-1log⁡3=2log⁡3

⇒ x+2log⁡2+1x-1log⁡3=0

⇒x=-2 or11-x=log2log⁡3

⇒1-x=log3log⁡2

⇒x=1-log3log⁡2

questions.name: The number of real solutions of the equation 5+26x2-3+5-26x2-3=10, is
questions.nameText: The number of real solutions of the equation 5+26x2-3+5-26x2-3=10, is
questions.solution:
We have,

5+26x2-3+5-25x2-3=5+26+5-26

⇒x2-3=± 1⇒x=± 2,± 2

questions.name: If the sum of the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 is equal to the sum of the squares of their reciprocals of their reciprocals, then
questions.nameText: If the sum of the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 is equal to the sum of the squares of their reciprocals of their reciprocals, then
questions.solution:
Let α,β be the roots of the given quadratic equation. Then,

α+β=-b/a,αβ=c/a

It is given that

α+β=1α2+1b2

⇒α2+β2=α+βα2β2

⇒α+β2-2 α β=α+βα β2

⇒b2a2-2ca=-bc2a3

⇒2ca=b2a2+bc2a3

⇒2a2c=ab2+bc2⇒c2b,a2c,b2a 𝑎are in A.P..

Dividing both sides of 2a2c-ab2+bc2 by abc, we get

2ab=bc+ca⇒bc,ab,caare in A.P.

questions.name: Let α,β be the roots of the equation x2-px+r=0 and α2, 2β be the roots of the equation x2-qx+r=0 . Then the value of r is
questions.nameText: Let α,β be the roots of the equation x2-px+r=0 and α2, 2β be the roots of the equation x2-qx+r=0 . Then the value of r is
questions.solution:
Since, the equation x2-px+r=0 has roots (α, β) and the equation x2-qx+r=0 has roots α2, 2β

∴  α+β=p and r=αβ and α2+2β=q

⇒ β=2q-p3 and α=2(2p-q)3

∴ αβ=r=292q-p(2p-q) )

questions.name: If the roots of x3-12x2+39x-28=0 are in A.P., then their common difference is
questions.nameText: If the roots of x3-12x2+39x-28=0 are in A.P., then their common difference is
questions.solution:
Let a-d,a,a+d be the roots of the equation x3-12x2+39 x-28=0. Then,

a-d+a+a+d=12 and, a-da+d=28

⇒3a=12 and aa2-d2=28

⇒a=4 and d=± 3

questions.name: If α and β are imaginary cube roots of unity, then α4+β4+1αβ is equal to
questions.nameText: If α and β are imaginary cube roots of unity, then α4+β4+1αβ  is equal to
questions.solution:
The complex cube roots of unity are 1, ω, ω2

Let α=ω,   β=ω2

Then, α4+β4+α-1β-1=ω4+ω24+ω-1ω2-1

=ω+ω2+1=0

questions.name: If α and β be the roots of the equation x2+xα+β=0 , then
questions.nameText: If α and β be the roots of the equation x2+xα+β=0 , then
questions.solution:
Since, α and β be the roots of the equation x2+αx+β=0 , therefore

α+β=-α and αβ=β

From second relation β≠0

∴  α=1

∴ 1+β=-1 ⇒ β=-2

Hence, α=1 and β=-2

questions.name: -1-1-1-...∞ is .equal to
questions.nameText: -1-1-1-...∞  is .equal to
questions.solution:
Let x=-1--1--1-...∞

Then, x=-1-xorx2=-1-x

or x2+x+1=0

∴  x=-1±1-4.1.12.1=-1±-32

= -1±3i2=ω  orω2

questions.name: If α, β, γ are the roots of the equation x3-7x+7=0 , then 1α4+1β4+1γ4 is
questions.nameText: If α, β, γ are the roots of the equation x3-7x+7=0 , then 1α4+1β4+1γ4  is
questions.solution:
Here, ∑α=0, ∑αβ=-7, αβγ=-7

∴1α4+1β4+1γ4=α4β4+β4γ4+γ4α4α4β4γ4

=∑α4β4α4β4γ4 ...((i)

Now, ∑αβ∑αβ∑αβ∑αβ=(∑αβ)2(∑αβ)2

⇒-74=[α2β2+β2γ2+γ2α2+2αβγα+β+γ]

[α2β2+β2γ2+γ2α2+2αβγα+β+γ]

=α2β2+β2γ2+γ2α2(α2β2+β2γ2+γ2α2)[∴∑α=α+β+γ=0]

=α4β4+β4γ4+γ4α4+2α4β2γ2+2α2β4γ2+2α2β2γ4

=∑α4β4+2α2β2γ2(α2+β2+γ4)

= ∑α4β4+2α2β2γ2(∑a)2-2∑αβ 

= ∑α4β4+2α2β2γ2 0-2×-7

=∑α4β4+2-72(2×7)

⇒ ∑α4β4=-74+4-73

⇒  ∑α4β4=-73-7+4=-3-73

On putting this value in Eq. (i) , we get

1α4+1β4+1γ4=-3-73-74=-3-7=37

questions.name: If the roots of x3-3x2-6x+8=0 are in arithmetic progression, then the roots of the equation are
questions.nameText: If the roots of x3-3x2-6x+8=0 are in arithmetic progression, then the roots of the equation are
questions.solution:
Sum of the roots

=-ba=--31=3

From the given options only (c) ie, -2, 1, 4 satisfies this condition

questions.name: The number of values of a for whicha2-3a+2x2+a2-5a+6x+a2-4=0 is an identity in x, ,is
questions.nameText: The number of values of a for whicha2-3a+2x2+a2-5a+6x+a2-4=0 is an identity in x, ,is
questions.solution:
If a2-3a+2x2+a2-5a+6x+a2-4=0 is an identity in x, ,then

a2-3a+2=0,a2-5a+6=0 =0andmust holdgood simultaneously.

Clearly, a=2 is the value of ''a'' which satisfies these equations

questions.name: The values of x satisfying x2+4x+3+2x+5=0 are
questions.nameText: The values of x satisfying x2+4x+3+2x+5=0 are
questions.solution:
CASE I

When x2+4x+3≥0 i.e. x≤-3 or x≥-1

In this case, we have

x2+4x+3=x2+4 x+3

∴x2+4x+3+2x+5=0

⇒x2+4x+3+2x+5=0

⇒x=-2,-4⇒x=-4[∵x≤-3 or, x≥-1]

CASE II

When x2+4x+3<0 i.e.-3<x<-1

In this case, we have

x2+4x+3=-(x2+4x+3)

∴x2+4x+3+2x+5=0

⇒-x2-4x-3+2x+5=0 =

⇒-x2-2x+2=0 =

⇒x2+2x-2=0

⇒x=-2±232=-1± 3

⇒x=-1-3        [∵-3<x<-1]

questions.name: If x=2+32-3 , then x2x-42 is equal to
questions.nameText: If x=2+32-3 , then x2x-42  is equal to
questions.solution:
Given, x=2+32-3=2+3(2+3)2-3(2+3)

=2+3

∴   x2x-44=2+322+3-42

=3+223-22

=32-222

=-12=1

questions.name: The number of real roots of the equation 2 x4+5 x2+3=0, is
questions.nameText: The number of real roots of the equation 2 x4+5 x2+3=0, is
questions.solution:
We have,

2x4+5x2+3>0 for all x∈R

So, 2x4+5x2+3=0 has no real root

questions.name: If α and β are the roots of x2-2x+4=0 , then the value of α6+β6 is
questions.nameText: If α and β are the roots of x2-2x+4=0 , then the value of α6+β6  is
questions.solution:
Given, α, β are the roots of x2-2x+4=0

∴ α+β=2 ...(i)

And αβ=4 ...(ii)

Now, α-β=α+β2-4αβ

=4-4×4=-12

⇒ α-β=23i ...(iii)

On solving Eqs. (i) and (ii0, we get

α=2+23i2=-2-1-3i2=-2ω2

And β=2-23i2=-2-1+3i2=-2ω

Now, α6+β6=-2ω26+-2ω6

=64ω34+64ω32

=128[∵ω3=1]

questions.name: If α and β are the roots of x2+px+1=0 and γ and δ are the roots of x2+qx+1=0, then the value of α-γβ-γα+δβ+δ, is
questions.nameText: If α and β are the roots of x2+px+1=0 and γ and δ are the roots of x2+qx+1=0, then the value of α-γβ-γα+δβ+δ, is
questions.solution:
Since α,β are the roots of the equation x2+px+1 and γ,δ are the roots of the equation x2+qx+1=0

∴α2+p α+1=0, β2+p β+1=0 ,,

γ2+q γ+1=0 and δ2+q δ+1=0 …(i)

Also, α+β=-p,α β=1,γ+δ=-q and γ δ=1

∴(α-γ)(β-γ)(α+δ)(β+δ)

=α β-γα+β+γ2α β+δα+β+δ2

=(γ2+p γ+1)(δ2-p δ+1)

=(pγ-qγ)(-q δ-p δ) [Using (i)]

=p+qq-pγ δ=(q2-p2)

questions.name: If the roots of the equation x2-bx+c=0 be two consecutive integers, then b2-4c equals
questions.nameText: If the roots of the equation x2-bx+c=0 be two consecutive integers, then b2-4c equals
questions.solution:
Let two consecutive integers n and n+1 be the roots of x2-bx+c=0 . Then, n+n+1=b and nn+1=c

∴  b2-4c=2n+12-4nn+1=1

questions.name: If  x2=x+2, wherex= the greatest integer less than or equal to x,then x must be such that
questions.nameText: If  x2=x+2, wherex= the greatest integer less than or equal to x,then x must be such that
questions.solution:
x2-x-2=0

⇒x-2x+1=0

⇒x=2, -1

⇒x∈-1, 0∪[2, 0]

questions.name: If the roots of the equation x2+px+q=0 are tan⁡30° and tan⁡15° respectively, ,then the value of 2+q-p is
questions.nameText: If the roots of the equation x2+px+q=0 are tan⁡30°  and tan⁡15°  respectively, ,then the value of 2+q-p is
questions.solution:
Since, tan⁡30° and tan⁡15° are the roots of equation

x2+px+q=0

∴  tan⁡30°+tan⁡15°=-p

And tan⁡30°tan⁡15°=q

Now, 2+q-p=2+tan⁡30°+tan⁡15°+tan⁡30°+tan⁡15°

=2+tan⁡30°+tan⁡15°+1-tan⁡30°tan⁡15°

∵tan⁡45°=tan⁡30°+tan⁡15°1-tan⁡30°tan⁡15°

⇒  2+q-p=3

questions.name: If ax2+bx+c=0 and 2x2+3x+4=0 have a common root where a, b, c∈N (set of natural numbers), the least value of a+b+c is
questions.nameText: If ax2+bx+c=0 and 2x2+3x+4=0 have a common root where a, b, c∈N (set of natural numbers), the least value of a+b+c is
questions.solution:
Let α be the common root of the given equations

Then, aα2+bα+c=0

And 2α2+3α+4=0

⇒    α2+a-2+αb-3+c-4=0

⇒a-2=0, b-3=0 and c-4=0

⇒a=2, b=3 and c=4

∴   a+b+c=2+3+4=9

questions.name: The solution set of the inequationx+4x-3≤2, is
questions.nameText: The solution set of the inequationx+4x-3≤2, is
questions.solution:
We have,

x+4x-3≤2

⇒x+4-2x+6x-3≤0

⇒-x-10x-3≤0⇒x-10x-3≥0⇒x∈-∞,3∪[10,∞)

questions.name: If α and β are the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 , αβ=3 and a, b, c are in AP, then α+β is equal to
questions.nameText: If α and β are the roots of the equation ax2+bx+c=0 , αβ=3 and a, b, c are in AP, then α+β is equal to
questions.solution:
Here, α+β=-ba and αβ=ca

But αβ=3   ⇒    c=3a

Also, b=a+c2    ⇒    b=a+3a2=2a

Hence, α+β=-2aa=-2

questions.name: For the equation x2+x-6=0
questions.nameText: For the equation x2+x-6=0

options.name: There are only two distinct roots
options.nameText: There are only two distinct roots

options.name: There are only three distinct roots
options.nameText: There are only three distinct roots

questions.solution:
We have,

x2+x-6=0

⇒x+3x-2=0

⇒x=2[∵x+3≠0]

⇒x=± 2

questions.name: If x,a,b,c are real and x-a+b2+x-b+c2=0, then a,b,c are in
questions.nameText: If x,a,b,c are real and x-a+b2+x-b+c2=0, then a,b,c are in
questions.solution:
We have,

x-a+b2+x-b+c2=0

⇒x-a+b=0 and x-b+c=0

⇒x=a-b and x=b-c

⇒a-b=b-c⇒2 b=a+c⇒a,b,c are in A.P.

questions.name: If the roots of the equation x2-2ax+a2+a-3=0 are real and less than 3, then
questions.nameText: If the roots of the equation x2-2ax+a2+a-3=0 are real and less than 3, then
questions.solution:
Given equation is x2-2ax+a2+a-3=0. .

If roots are real then D≥0

⇒4a2-4(a2+a-3)≥0

⇒ -a+3≥0

⇒ a-3≤0⇒a≤3

As roots are less than 3, hence f3>0

9-6a+a2+a-3>0

⇒a2-5a+6>0

⇒a-2a-3>0

⇒Either a<2 or a>3.

Hence, only a<2 satisfy.

questions.name: If 1+x2=3x, ,then ∑n=124xn-1xn2 is equal to
questions.nameText: If 1+x2=3x, ,then ∑n=124xn-1xn2  is equal to
questions.solution:
We have,

1+x2=3x

⇒x2-3 x+1=0 ⇒x=3+i2=-i ω,i ω2

Clearly, -i ω and i ω2 are reciprocal of each other and the given expression does not alter by replacing x by 1x. So, we will compute its value for one of these two values of x

For x=i ω2, we have

∑n=124xn-1xn2=∑n=124i ω2n--i ωn2

⇒∑n=124xn-1xn2=∑n=124-1nω2n--1nωn2

⇒∑n=124xn-1xn2=∑k=18-13kω6k--13kω3k2+∑k=07-13k+1ω6k+2--13k+1ω3k+1+∑k=07-13k+2ω6k+4--13k+2ω3k+2

=∑k=18-13k1--13k2+∑k=07-13k+1ω2--13k+1ω2+∑k=07ω--13k+2ω22

=∑k=18-13k2-2-13k+∑k=07-13k+1ω+ω2-2-13k+1+∑k=07-13k+2ω2+ω-2-13k+2

=-4×4+∑k=07-13k-1-1+2-13k+2+∑k=07-13k+2{-1+2-13k+3}

=-16+-1×4+-3×4+{-3×4+4×-1}

= -48

questions.name: If α,β are the roots of x2+bx-c=0, then the equation whose roots are b and c is
questions.nameText: If α,β are the roots of x2+bx-c=0, then the equation whose roots are b and c is
questions.solution:
Since α,β are roots of x2+bx-c=0

∴α+β=-b, αβ=-c

The equation whose roots are b,c is

x2-xb+c+bc=0

⇒x2-x-α-β-α β+α βα+β=0

⇒x2+xα+β+α β+α βα+β=0

questions.name: The value of 441  442  443445  446  447449  450  451 is
questions.solution:
441  442  443445  446  447449  450  451=441  1  1445  1  1449 1  1

C2→C2-C1

C3→C3-C2

=0 [∵ two columns are identical]

questions.name:
l,m,n are the 𝑝th, 𝑞th and 𝑟th terms of an GP and all

Positive, thenlog⁡lp1log⁡mq1log⁡nr1 equals
questions.nameText:
l,m,n are the 𝑝th, 𝑞th and 𝑟th terms of an GP and all 

Positive, thenlog⁡lp1log⁡mq1log⁡nr1  equals
questions.solution:
Let A and R be the first term and common ratio respectively.

∴l=ARp-1

⇒log⁡l=log⁡A+p-1log⁡R

m=ARq-1

⇒log⁡m=log⁡A+q-1log⁡R

and n=ARr-1

⇒ log n=log⁡A+r-1log⁡R

Now, log⁡lp1log⁡mq1log⁡nr1=log⁡A+p-1log⁡Rp1log⁡A+q-1log⁡Rq1log⁡A+r-1log⁡Rr1

On multiplying R1,R2 andR3 byq-r,r-p andp-q and addingR1+R2+R3, we get

=q-r+r-p+p-q.log⁡A+{(q-r)(p-1)

+r-pq-1+p-q(r-1)} log⁡ R

=0

questions.name:
The system of equations

kx+y+z=1

x+ky+z=k

x+y+kz=k2

have no solution, if k equals
questions.nameText:
The system of equations

kx+y+z=1 

x+ky+z=k 

x+y+kz=k2 

have no solution, if k equals
questions.solution:
The system of equations

k x+y+z=1

x+k y+z=k

x+y+k z=k2

Is inconsistent, if

∆=k111k111k=0 and one of the ∆1,∆2∆3 is non-zero, where

∆1=111kk1k21k,∆2=k111k11k2k,∆3=k111kk11k2

We have, ∆=k+2k-12,∆1=-k+1k-12

∆2=-kk-12, ∆3=k+12k-12

Clearly, for k=-2, we have

∆=0 and ∆1,∆2,∆3 are non-zero-. Therefore, k=-2 ,=

questions.name: ∆=aa+ba+b+c3a4a+3b5a+4b+3c6a9a+6b11a+9b+6c , where a=i, b=ω, c=ω2, then ∆ is equal to
questions.nameText: ∆=aa+ba+b+c3a4a+3b5a+4b+3c6a9a+6b11a+9b+6c , where a=i, b=ω, c=ω2, then ∆ is equal to
questions.solution:
We have,

∆=aa+ba+b+c3a4a+3b5a+4b+3c6a9a+6b11a+9b+6c

Applying R2→R2-3R1, R3→R3-2R2

=aaa+b+c0a2a+b0aa+b

=a[a2+ab-2a2-ab]

=-a3=i(∵a=i, ,given))

questions.name: If C=2cos⁡θ , then the value of the determinant ∆=C101C161C is
questions.nameText: If C=2cos⁡θ , then the value of the determinant ∆=C101C161C  is
questions.solution:
Given that C=2cos⁡θ

and ∆=C101C161C=CC2-1-1(C-6)

∆=2cos⁡θ(4cos2⁡θ-1)-(2cos⁡θ-6)(∵C=2cos⁡θ)

⇒ ∆=8cos3⁡θ-4cos⁡θ+6

questions.name: If a-1+b-1+c-1=0 such that 1+a1111+b1111+c=λ then value of λ is
questions.nameText: If a-1+b-1+c-1=0 such that 1+a1111+b1111+c=λ then value of λ is
questions.solution:
We have, 1+a1111+b1111+c=λ

Applying C2→C2-C1andC3→C3-C1

⇒ 1+a-a-a1b010c=λ

On expanding w.r.t. R3 , we get

ab+bc+ca+abc=λ ...(i)

Given a-1+ b-1+c-1=0

1a+1b+1c=0

⇒ab+bc+ca=0

From Eq. (i), λ=abc

questions.name: Let A=1sin⁡θ1-sin⁡θ1sin⁡θ-1-sin⁡θ1, where 0≤θ<2 π. Then, which of the following is not correct?
questions.nameText: Let A=1sin⁡θ1-sin⁡θ1sin⁡θ-1-sin⁡θ1, where 0≤θ<2 π. Then, which of the following is not correct?
questions.solution:
We have,

det⁡A=1sin⁡θ1-sin⁡θ1sin⁡θ-1-sin⁡θ1=2(1+sin2⁡θ)

Now,

0≤sin2⁡θ≤1 for all θ∈[0,2 π) )

⇒2≤2+2sin2⁡θ≤4 for all θ∈[0,2 π)

⇒Det⁡(A)∈[2,4]

questions.name: 15πloge⁡e55log10⁡105e is equal to
questions.nameText: 15πloge⁡e55log10⁡105e  is equal to
questions.solution:
Let ∆=15πloge⁡e55log10⁡105e

⇒ ∆=15π15515e=511π11511e(∵loga⁡a=1)

=0 (∵ two columns are identical)

questions.name: If A is an invertible matrix, then det⁡(A-1) is equal to
questions.nameText: If A is an invertible matrix, then det⁡(A-1)  is equal to
questions.solution:
We have,

AA-1=I

⇒det⁡AA-1=det⁡(I)

⇒det⁡Adet⁡A-1=1∵det⁡A B=det⁡Adet⁡Band,det⁡I=1

⇒det⁡A-1=1det⁡(A)

questions.name: If fx=a-10axa-1ax2axa, then f2x-f(x) is equal to
questions.nameText: If fx=a-10axa-1ax2axa, then f2x-f(x) is equal to
questions.solution:
fx=a-10axa-1ax2axa

Applying R3→R3-xR2

fx=a-10axa-100a+x=a+x(a2+ax)

⇒fx=aa+x2

∴f2x=aa+2x2

⇒f2x-fx=ax(2a+3x)

questions.name: The value of λ such that x+3y+λz=0, 2x+4y-z=0, x+5y-2z=0 has a non-trivial solution is
questions.nameText: The value of λ such that x+3y+λz=0, 2x+4y-z=0, x+5y-2z=0 has a non-trivial solution is
questions.solution:
Since, given equations have a non-trivial solution

∴               ∆=0

⇒1        3     λ2       4   -11       5  -2=0

⇒1-8+5-3-4+1+λ10-4=0

⇒ 6λ=-6   ⇒    λ=-1

questions.name: Ifx-y-z-y+zz=053, than the values of x , y and z are respectively
questions.nameText: Ifx-y-z-y+zz=053, than the values of x , y and z are respectively
questions.solution:
From given matrix equation, we have

x-y-z=0

-y+z=5

z=3

⇒            x=1,y=-2,z=3

questions.name: If A and B are matrices of the same order, then A+B2=A2+2 AB+B2 is possible, ,iff
questions.nameText: If A and B are matrices of the same order, then A+B2=A2+2 AB+B2  is possible, ,iff
questions.solution:
We have,

A+B2=A2+2 AB+B2

⇔A+BA+B=A2+2 AB+B2

⇔A2+A B+B A+B2=A2+2 A B+B2

⇔A B=B A

Hence, A+B2=A2+2 AB+B2⇔A B=B A

questions.name: The system of simultaneous equations kx+2y-z=1 k-1y-2z=2 and k+2z=3 has a unique solution, if k equals
questions.nameText: The system of simultaneous equations kx+2y-z=1 k-1y-2z=2 and k+2z=3 has a unique solution, if k equals
questions.solution:
For unique solution,

k2-10k-1-200k+2≠0

⇒  kk-1k+2≠0

⇒  k≠0, 1 or -2

=2×2007×20082-2007=20072

questions.name: What must be the matrix X if 2X+1  23  4=3  87  2?
questions.nameText: What must be the matrix X if 2X+1  23  4=3  87  2?
questions.solution:
Give equation can be written as,

2X=3  87  2-1  23  4

⇒2X=2      64 -2=21     32 -1

⇒   X=1      32 -1
